title: AC Milan 'could turn to Luciano Spalletti, Stefano Pioli or bring Gennaro Gatusso'
text:
AC Milan are eyeing a move for Luciano Spalletti or Stefano Pioli to replace Marco Giampaolo, according to reports.

The current Milan manager is under pressure despite a 2-1 away victory against Genoa at the weekend as the team's performance was not considered to be up to scratch.

Spalletti or Pioli are the prime targets to take over from Giampaolo but they could even bring back Gennaro Gattuso.

AC Milan are eyeing a move for Luciano Spalletti to replace Marco Giampaolo

Stefano Pioli could be another option to take over at the San Siro if Giampaolo leaves

Sky Sport Italia are reporting that Milan are 'reflecting' on Giampaolo's role and are not denying that he could potentially be dismissed.

They have also suggested Gattuso could be brought back, although that would rely on Paolo Maldini leaving the directorial staff at Milan.

Rudi Garcia and Claudio Ranieri are also thought to be in the running for the job.

Elliott Management, the US hedge fund who own Milan, are considering an overhaul of the senior staff, which could facilitate Gattuso's return.
description: The current Milan manager is under pressure despite a 2-1 away victory against Genoa at the weekend as the team's performance was not considered to be up to scratch.
